item.title: [renamed] Interfaces
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

RSInterface scroll = addTabInterface(IDHere);
tab.child(4, IDHere, 0, 25);
scroll.width = ###; scroll.height = ###; scroll.scrollMax = ###;

If you’ve been making interfaces, you should know where to put them.

item.title: [renamed] Interfaces
item.dc:creator: @chri55w chri55w
item.description:
@chri55w wrote:

okay so ive been adding a few interfaces to my client today, managed the first one fine (click here to see) and im trying to add a scrollbar to the second one (my first time making interfaces) and i cant figure out how to add it, havent got too far on this interface as the majority of it will be within the scrollbar

this is the code i have so far

[code] public static void itemList(RSFont[] wid) {
RSInterface rsinterface = addInterface(36739);
addSprite3(36740, 0, 2);
addHover(36741, 3, 0, 36742, 1, “Interfaces/ResetSkill/SPRITE”, 17, 17, “Close Window”);
addHovered(36742, 3, “Interfaces/ResetSkill/SPRITE”, 17, 17, 36743);
addText(36744, “Item List”, wid, 2, 0xff981f);
rsinterface.children = new int[4]; rsinterface.childX = new int[4]; rsinterface.childY = new int[4];

	rsinterface.children[0] = 36740;		rsinterface.childX[0] = 150;		rsinterface.childY[0] = 17;
	rsinterface.children[1] = 36741;		rsinterface.childX[1] = 364;		rsinterface.childY[1] = 19;        
	rsinterface.children[2] = 36742;		rsinterface.childX[2] = 364;		rsinterface.childY[2] = 19;
	rsinterface.children[3] = 36744;		rsinterface.childX[3] = 235;		rsinterface.childY[3] = 19;
}[/code]

im not asking to be spoon-fed, but some hints would be appreciated

thanks
